title: Linux uncompress Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the uncompress command in Linux to decompress Gzipped files. Understand the purpose of the command and troubleshoot compression and decompression issues.

meta.title: Linux uncompress Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the uncompress command in Linux to decompress Gzipped files. Understand the purpose of the command and troubleshoot compression and decompression issues.
meta.keywords: Linux, uncompress, Gzip, decompression, compression, archiving

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the uncompress Command

verify.name: Verify the purpose of the uncompress command
verify.hint: The uncompress command is not installed or not available in your environment. Please ensure that the GNU gzip package is installed before proceeding with the next steps.

steps.title: Decompress a Gzipped File Using the uncompress Command

verify.name: Verify the decompression of the Gzipped file
verify.hint: The decompressed file 'sample.txt' does not exist or the contents do not match the expected output. Please ensure that you have successfully decompressed the Gzipped file using the uncompress command.
